data.message: For those who say the dont like slaughterhouse and yelawolf on the album, get used to hearing them. Em's gonna do what ever he can to jam those guys down your throats. At least they are actually good and have a true understanding of the music they are making. Probably Some of the only guys I think that I could tolerate partnering up with Eminem

replies.message: Fucking love the album btw! 8/10 cause I think the greatest hits section wasn't thought through very well.

Idk, i really dont like that hammer dance song by slaughter house, when i heard that i was instantly turned away from them, it seems nigga is just about the only word in it, and i find the quality of production has gone way way way down compared to eminems solo work, when eminem works on his own, or with whats his nuts from the song lighters, the production quality was absolutely insane, every snare, every sound, every vocal was very very clear and crisp and true eminem style, i find he has begun to drift away from that, im a die hard eminem fan and to each his own but in my opinion i dont like slaughter house, well the one guy from hammer dance i dont mind the rest of them they are all extremely talented, well rounded and incredible with their lyrics, i think eminem is making a step in the right direction but he needs to up hisproduction quality like it once was for example on the marshal mathers lp 1
Slaughterhouse are only ones who are making real hip hop
